I recently had an incredibly frustrating experience with Super.com while attempting to book a hotel reservation for November 8th. The ordeal was so exasperating that I felt compelled to share my ordeal, hoping that no one else falls into the same trap. Booking #B_11915596

The fundamental issue I encountered with Super.com was the alarming level of deception on their website. The booking process was utterly misleading and left me feeling scammed. As soon as I selected the hotel I wanted, the website swiftly directed me to the payment section without a chance to confirm my booking details. Before I knew it, I had paid for a hotel reservation on the very same day I intended to stay, despite my explicit selection of November 8th.

I immediately realized the error and attempted to rectify it by contacting their customer service. However, this presented another challenge. It took several attempts to reach a live representative, which was incredibly frustrating. When I finally got through, the individual I spoke to was unable to resolve my issue. This lack of effective customer support only added to my mounting frustration.

The crux of the problem lies in the website's design and functionality, which makes it extremely easy for users to inadvertently book the wrong date. Super.com's website is designed in a way that appears user-friendly, but it masks its true intent – to trick unsuspecting customers into making erroneous bookings. It leaves little room for users to review their selections and confirm their choices before proceeding to payment.

In sum, my experience with Super.com was nothing short of a nightmare. The combination of their deceptive website design and the lack of responsive customer support left me feeling duped and frustrated. I sincerely hope that by sharing my experience, others can avoid falling victim to this misleading platform. My advice: approach Super.com with extreme caution, and double-check your reservations meticulously before clicking that payment button.

I have recently had the most disappointing and frustrating experience with Super.com. My interaction with this company has been characterized by extreme deception and a complete lack of assistance when I encountered an issue with a hotel booking through their "Super Booking Application."

I made a reservation for the Ibis Doha hotel (B_11553815) for the dates of October 12th and 13th. However, the confirmation I received indicated entirely different dates - October 19th and 20th. This is not only misleading but could be seen as outright fraudulent.

Despite immediately reaching out to their customer service department to address this significant discrepancy, my experience went from bad to worse. Super.com's automated services proved to be completely unhelpful, refusing to correct the glaring mistake. Even when confronted with an issue that was clearly caused by their platform, they insisted on not assisting or making any effort to rectify the situation.

What's more, when it became evident that Super.com would do whatever it takes to avoid any contact and refuse to solve any issues that might arise, I took the initiative to report the transaction as fraud to my bank. The lack of response from Super.com left me with no other viable option to protect my interests and financial well-being.

This level of unresponsiveness, coupled with their failure to take responsibility for their errors and misleading information, is simply unacceptable. It is an affront to customer trust and confidence.

I would strongly advise anyone considering using Super.com to think twice. My experience has been a complete letdown, and I cannot emphasize enough how important it is to be cautious when relying on their services. Their inability or unwillingness to rectify mistakes of this nature is a red flag, and their commitment to customer satisfaction is, at best, questionable.

In sum, my experience with Super.com has been marred by deception, a complete lack of assistance, and a failure to take responsibility for a glaring error on their part. I urge anyone considering their services to proceed with extreme caution, as my experience has left me highly dissatisfied and disappointed.

While Super.com may initially catch your eye with their competitive hotel booking prices, my experience with their customer service has been nothing short of disappointing, disorganised, and, most significantly, exorbitantly costly.

I found myself with a problem when my friend and I mistakenly booked hotel accommodations for the wrong dates. With our travel date fast approaching, we knew we needed to rectify the situation as swiftly as possible. Super.com offered a glimmer of hope, stating that, for an administrative fee and pending the hotel's approval, they could attempt to amend our reservation. We were told that their amendments team would liaise with the hotel on our behalf.

However, this is where the ordeal began. For an entire week, we received no updates, despite sending follow-up emails. Frustrated and running out of time, I decided to call the customer service team using the phone number displayed on the Super.com website. Little did I know that these calls would cost me a whopping £555 ($689), a fee that was never disclosed beforehand. During those excruciating days leading up to our trip, I made a total of nine phone calls to Super.com, mostly spent waiting on hold or in a queue.

To make matters worse, it turned out that no one from Super.com had actually contacted the hotel on our behalf, as they had claimed in their email and on the phone. I personally reached out to the hotel, only to find out that they had no record of Super.com's communication. This blatant misrepresentation of their efforts left us bewildered and frustrated.

After numerous phone calls and conflicting information, we received an email from customer services stating that they could not amend our booking, even with the hotel's approval. Instead, they suggested that we contact the hotel ourselves to request a refund and then obtain written approval to send back to Super.com. This was a stark contradiction to the information we had initially received. Exhausted from the runaround and time constraints, we had no choice but to change our plans and book new flights to accommodate the existing reservation.

To our surprise, shortly after our decision, we received yet another email from a different Super.com representative claiming that they were diligently working with the hotel to change our dates and were awaiting a call back from the hotel. This sudden change in stance only added to our confusion and frustration.

While Super.com's customer service can be reached via email, their response times are painfully slow, rendering meaningful communication nearly impossible, especially when time-sensitive travel plans are involved. Moreover, the misinformation they provided about their communication with the hotel demonstrated a lack of honesty in assisting us.

While we acknowledge our initial mistake, it was Super.com's initial assurance that they could assist us (for a fee) that led us to persist in seeking their help. The eventual revelation that they couldn't provide the service they had promised was not only immensely frustrating but also costly, as evidenced by my shockingly high phone bill.

I have submitted this complaint to Super.com, and despite more than a week passing, including a follow-up email, I have yet to receive any response from them regarding this matter. I am also exploring my consumer rights regarding the undisclosed call charges incurred.

I remain open to discussing this matter with Super.com if they respond to my emails

I have called, and e-mailed, repeatedly since making the reservation, was told that "Don't worry, your reservation is confirmed" but they REFUSE to put me in touch with a Supervisor or Manager, despite repeatedly asking to speak with one.  I was told I would receive a call back in 24-48 hours, but no call backs from anyone.  Sometimes, I received an e-mail back stating "We are working on resolving your issue". The worst experience on a vacation I've had thus far. I had 2 rooms reserved far in advance with super.com and reserving.com (with the purchased insurance mind you, both terrible agencies in refunding you your money). If you read the Diez Hotel website they claim both just a valid photo ID and easy cancellation if you run into any issues (see the screenshot for verification or the hotel's FAQs section). 

Day 1 - We arrive at Medellin and it is raining. Immediately we try to check in to our already paid-for rooms with passport and/or government-issued IDs. However, the hotel denied our party the ability to check in because there is an "unwritten rule" that government IDs must be Colombian despite this not being a written policy anywhere nor a warning upon reservation. The hotel did not attempt to remediate the issue or be helpful whatsoever despite already being paid $800 for 2 rooms. Fortunately, other hotels nearby do not play these games and were more than welcoming to provide us rooms (tyvm Jo and Joe Hotel, they were half the price and super accommodating having no said policy to accept paying guests).

For the entirety of the vacation, I spent the week trying to get my $800 reimbursed by the hotel and reservation agencies because no service or rooms were provided. However, surprise surprise no one wants to return the money (even after purchasing the insurance with the reservation company!) and I am working ways to recoup my expenses having already paid half of that for 2 rooms with Jo and Joe Hotel, which again, were more than amazing and cheaper.

Stay away from Diez Hotel and this reservation company if you don't want to be robbed of your money. Worst experience in a vacation so far.
